Package communication

Class NetworkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java_websocket.WebSocketAdapter
      • org.java_websocket.AbstractWebSocket
        • org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
          • communication.NetworkHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.java_websocket.WebSocketListener
    public class NetworkHandler
extends org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
    This is the class that implements the server used for the communication with the clients
    Author:
    Adrian Groeber, Luka Stoehr

      • onError

        public void onError​(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                    java.lang.Exception ex)
        The onError method is called when an error occurs. If an error causes the WebSocket connection to fail, onClose will be called additionally.
        Specified by:
        onError in class org.java_websocket.server.WebSocketServer
        Parameters:
        conn - the WebSocket connection which the error occurred on
        ex - the Exception which has been detected

      • protocolViolation

        public void protocolViolation​(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                              Profile profile)
        This method is called if a protocol violation has been detected. It will send a GoodByeClient message and then close the connection and delete the profile from the profileList.
        Parameters:
        conn - the WebSocket the violation has been detected on
        profile - the profile of the client which has caused the violation

      • checkProfileList

        public Profile checkProfileList​(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String deviceID)
        This method is called in the onMessage method when a helloServer message has been received to check if there is already a profile for the client in the profileList. If this is the case, the already existing profile is returned. Else a new profile is created and returned.
        Parameters:
        conn - the WebSocket of the new/reconnecting client
        name - the name of the new/reconnecting client
        deviceID - the deviceID of the new/reconnecting client
        Returns:
        method returns the final profile for the client

      • checkAttachment

        public boolean checkAttachment​(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                               MessageType previous,
                               MessageType current)
        This method checks if the client follows the correct succession of messages as specified in the network protocol. In detail, it looks into the Attachment object attached to the WebSocket and checks if the checkpoint variable has stored the correct messageType. If the Attachment object is null or if the messageType is wrong it returns false. EXAMPLE: If the onMessage method receives a PlayerReady message, the previous message of the client had to be a HelloServer message which means that this method checks if the checkPoint variable equals the HELLO_SERVER type. If the attachment is valid the checkpoint is updated and the Attachment is reattached to the WebSocket.
        Parameters:
        conn - the WebSocket for which the attachment object should be verified
        previous - the messageType which is expected to be in the checkPoint variable of the Attachment
        current - the messageType which has to be filled into the checkPoint variable of the Attachment
        Returns:
        returns true if the Attachment is valid which means there is no protocol violation

      • checkPlayerIdentity

        public Player checkPlayerIdentity​(Profile profile)
        This method is called to check if a Profile is connected to a Player object
        Parameters:
        profile - profile which is checked
        Returns:
        method returns the player the profile is associated with or null if there is no player with the same profile found

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast​(MessageStructure messageStructure,
                      Player player)
        This method is used to send a MessageStructure object to the Players and the Spectators. It also appends the Ack message for the player who sent the request at the start of the Message Array
        Parameters:
        messageStructure - The object containing the message array
        player - the player who send the successful request

      • processRequest

        public void processRequest​(org.java_websocket.WebSocket conn,
                           ExtractorMessage requestMessage)
        The processRequest method is used to 1. distinguish the type of the Request and and convert it into a Message object 2. check if the Request was sent by a player 3. pass the Request to the corresponding method of controller 4. sent Ack + Events / Nack + Gamestate to the Player 5 broadcast the Events to everyone else
        Parameters:
        conn - The WebSocket which received the message
        requestMessage - The Request which has to be handled by the RequestHandler

      • turnOverTimeAction

        public static void turnOverTimeAction​(Player player,
                                      Controller controller)
        This method is used to define an actionListener for the case a player takes to long for his turn
        Parameters:
        player - The Player the overTimeAction is set for

      • timeoutAction

        public void timeoutAction​(Player player)
        This method is used to define an actionListener for the case a player looses his connection and doesn't reconnect in time.
        Parameters:
        player - The Player the timeoutAction is set for
